title: American_Top_40_1982_May_22nd
description:
"Every week AT40 counts down the most popular songs in the USA from Near Island, Alaska, to Far Hills, New Jersey. At number 17 this week here's the J. Geils Band; their song, 'Freeze-Frame'."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

"Tainted Love" by Soft Cell entered the hot 100 in January of 1982. It climbed to number 64 and then fell to number 100. Now, nineteen weeks later it is in the top 40 at number 39.

Casey issues a correction. A few weeks prior he said that the largest number ever quoted in a chart song title was in Dickey Lee's "9,999,999 Tears." But several listeners wrote in that a man named Alice holds the title-winning title. Casey gives the details.

A listener wants to know if any married couples have ever hit the top 40. Casey says it has happened plenty of times, and then lists the nine couples that have hit number one.

This is the second week for Joan Jett & The Blackhearts's second hit, "Crimson & Clover" (at number 21). Casey tells how hard she worked to put it there. 

Another listener writes in to ask if any top 40 hits have included real animal noises. Casey plays parts of songs that include sounds from real life crickets, dogs, birds, and a coyote, a horse, & a lion.

LW#3: Don't Talk To Strangers - Rick Springfield
LW#2: Chariots Of Fire - Vangelis
LW#1: Ebony And Ivory - Paul McCartney & Stevie Wonder
